method.name: Fuzzy Rule Learning, grammar-based GP algorithm

reference.ref: L. Sánchez and I. Couso. Combining GP Operators With SA Search To Evolve Fuzzy Rule Based Classifiers. Information Sciences 136:(1-4) (2001) 175-192.

generalDescription.objective: To obtain fuzzy classifiers by means of learning fuzzy rule throught GP algorithms.
generalDescription.howWork:
A GP algorithm is used to learn a fuzzy classifier. For each hypothesis, the number of labels and number of rules must be given. In same way, as it is possible to manage any combination of conjuntion and/or disjuntions in the antecedent part of a fuzzy rule, a maximum deep tree size must be given too.
Those parameters are, in conjuntion with GP typical parameters, of capital importance in the evolution of this method.

parameterSpec.param: numlabes: the number of possible fuzzy values for each variable.
numrules: the number of rules for each classifier.
popsize: the number of individuals in the population, GA-P parameter.
numisland: the number of islands or subpopulations, GAP parameter.
steady: indicates how population evolves. A value of 1 forces a steady, while a value of 0 indicates that new individuals substitute old ones. GP parameter.
numitera: number of iterations to reach the objectives, GP parameter.
toursize: number of individuals selected to tournament selection procedure. GP parameter.
probmuta: indicates the probability that a mutation operation takes place, GP parameter.
amplmuta : the maximum bias that a mutation operation can introduce. GP Parameter.
probmigra: probability that an individual of an island is used in a tournament of another island, GP parameter.
proboptimlocal: indicates the probability to improve GP with local search GP parameter.
numoptimlocal: the number of local search steps, GP parameter.
idoptimlocal: the local search method used, GP parameter.
nichingap: value 1 if niches are going to be used, , GP parameter.
maxindniche: maximum number of individual per niche, , GP parameter.
probintraniche: probability that a genetic operation can take place with individual of different niches, GP parameter.
probcrossga: probability of genetic algorithm (parametric) operations to take place, GP parameter.
probmutaga: probability of genetic algorithm (structural) operations to take place, GP parameter.
lenchaingap: length of GP chain, GP parameter.
maxtreeheight: maximum deep of a fuzzy tree.

method.example:
Problem type: Classification Method: Clas-Fuzzy-GP Dataset: iris Training set: iris-10-1tra.dat Test set: iris-10-1tst.dat Test Show results: StatChekCL Parameters: numlabels: 3 numrules: 8 popsize: 30 numisland: 2 steady: 1 numitera: 1000 toursize: 4 probmuta: 0.01 amplmuta: 0.1 probmigra: 0.001 proboptimlocal: 0 numoptimlocal: 0 idoptimlocal: 0 lenchaingap: 10 maxtreeheight: 8
After the execution of RunKeel.jar we can see into the experiment/results/StatCheckCL/TSTClas-Fuzzy-GP folder the classification results for the test set:
TEST RESULTS ============ Classifier= iris_plants_database Fold 0 : CORRECT=0.8 N/C=0.0 Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.2 stddev Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.0 Correctly classified: 0.8 Global N/C: 0.0
TRAIN RESULTS ============ Classifier= iris_plants_database Summary of data, Classifiers: iris_plants_database Fold 0 : CORRECT=0.9407407407407408 N/C=0.0 Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.05925925925925926 stddev Global Classification Error + N/C: 0.0 Correctly classified: 0.9407407407407408 Global N/C: 0.0
We can see too the output and target classes for each case of the train set (result0s0.tra) in experiment/results/Clas-Fuzzy-GP/iris/:
@relation Iris_Plants_Database @attribute sepalLength real[4.3,7.9] @attribute sepalWidth real[2.0,4.4] @attribute petalLength real[1.0,6.9] @attribute petalWidth real[0.1,2.5] @attribute class{Iris-setosa,Iris-versicolor,Iris-virginica} @inputs sepalLength,sepalWidth,petalLength,petalWidth @outputs class @data Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa ...
And the test results (result0s0.tst) in experiment/results/Clas-Fuzzy-GP/iris/:
@relation Iris_Plants_Database @attribute sepalLength real[4.3,7.9] @attribute sepalWidth real[2.0,4.4] @attribute petalLength real[1.0,6.9] @attribute petalWidth real[0.1,2.5] @attribute class{Iris-setosa,Iris-versicolor,Iris-virginica} @inputs sepalLength,sepalWidth,petalLength,petalWidth @outputs class @data Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-setosa Iris-versicolor Iris-versicolor Iris-versicolor Iris-versicolor Iris-versicolor Iris-versicolor Iris-versicolor Iris-versicolor Iris-versicolor Iris-virginica Iris-virginica Iris-virginica Iris-virginica Iris-virginica Iris-virginica Iris-versicolor Iris-virginica Iris-virginica Iris-virginica Iris-versicolor
